intro: Lagenocarpus melanocarpus, commonly known as the black-fruited sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its triangular stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. Its most distinctive feature is its dark purple to black berries, which are borne in clusters. Lagenocarpus melanocarpus is often found in wetlands, marshes, and other moist habitats.
